title: The young mans joys compleated. Or, The coy damsel conquered by his pure love and loyalty. She first deny'd to be his bride, least he should prove unjust; but when she knew his love was true she set his heart at rest. To the tune of, O so ungrateful a creature. This may be printed. R.P.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for J[osiah]. Blare, at the Looking-Glass on London-Bridge.,
